original:
The "Escuela Quiteña" (Quito School) emerged as a significant artistic movement during the colonial period in Ecuador. Following the conquest of the Americas, Quito attracted numerous European artists, leading to the establishment of a prominent school that would influence art throughout Latin America, including Chile.

Founded by Franciscan friars, the Quito School was characterized by its deep religious themes. One of its most notable
